title: International real income comparisons
text: Neary uses set 11 goods 60 countries. assembled data Neary2004 data set available pppindexr package. addition prices “quantites” (expenditure US prices), country names population, ICP baseline year 1980. can use implemented quantity index functions add indices data. scale observations minimum (Ethiopia), way Geary Table 1 Figure 1. First extract price quantity matrices (, fact, dataframes): add indices Neary2004 dataset. enter two different Geary-Khamis numbers: one one without weighting population size. Now list data compare Table 1 Neary: Inspecting table, eks, ccd, gk columns replicate exactly corresponding columns Table 1 Neary (2004), population weighted Geary Khamis (gk_pop) numbers slightly different ones reported Neary (gk). means Neary calculated Geary-Khamis quantities without population weighting, believe contrary standard practice - means subdividing gdp region within country (uniform within-country prices) lead different world prices, hence also different real income indices. Geary Khamis world prices calculated follows:
code: P <- Neary2004[, c("p1","p2","p3","p4","p5","p6","p7","p8","p9","p10","p11")] Q <- Neary2004[, c("q1","q2","q3","q4","q5","q6","q7","q8","q9","q10","q11")] Neary2004$eks = eks(P,Q) Neary2004$ccd = ccd(P,Q) Neary2004$gk =  ygk(P,Q, min_scale = TRUE) Neary2004$gk_pop =  ygk(P,Q, pop=Neary2004$pop1980, min_scale = TRUE) Neary2004[,c("country","eks","ccd","gk","gk_pop")] |> knitr::kable(digits=3) prices <- data.frame(N = 1:11,                  p_gk = pgk(P,Q),                  p_gk_pop = pgk(P,Q, pop=Neary2004$pop1980)) prices |>  knitr::kable(digits=3)

title: International real income comparisons
text: Peter J. Neary (2004). “Rationalizing Penn World Table: True Multilateral Indices International Comparisons Real Income.” American Economic Review, 94 (5): 1411-1428. [https://www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/0002828043052286]

what: Price and Quantity Indices for International Comparisons
title: Price and Quantity Indices for International Comparisons
text: Price Quantity Indices International Comparisons: EKS, CCD, Geary-Khamis real income indices. Basic functionality tests implemented, reasonable unit tests.

title: Price and Quantity Indices for International Comparisons
text: can install development version pppindexr GitHub :

title: Price and Quantity Indices for International Comparisons
text: Let us look 3x2 example (three countries unequal size, two goods) define arbitrary prices quantities (one row per country): quantity indices scaled respect “country” lowest real income.
code: library(pppindexr) ex1 <- data.frame(   population = c(1, 2, 3),   p1 = c(1, 2, 1),   p2 = c(1, 1, 3),   q1 = c(1, 1, 1),   q2 = c(3, 1, 2) ) # CCD, EKS,  and Gheary Khamis indices: ex1$eks = eks(ex1[, 2:3], ex1[, 4:5]) ex1$ccd = ccd(ex1[, 2:3], ex1[, 4:5]) ex1$gk  = ygk(ex1[, 2:3], ex1[, 4:5],                pop = ex1$population, min_scale=TRUE) ex1 |> knitr::kable(digits=3)

what: Population, Prices, and Quantities for 60 countries (1980). — Neary2004
title: Population, Prices, and Quantities for 60 countries (1980). — Neary2004
text: dataset prices quantities 11 goods 60 countries 1980. Prices expenditure collected around world International Comparison Project, rescaled dataset US prices set unity, quantities measured expenditues USD.

title: Population, Prices, and Quantities for 60 countries (1980). — Neary2004
Population, Prices, and Quantities for 60 countries (1980). — Neary2004
text: data frame 60 rows 24 variables: country Name country (chr) pop1980 1980 population country (thousands) p1 Price food p2 Price beverages p3 Price tobacco p4 Price clothing footwear p5 Price gross rents p6 Price fuel power p7 Price house furnishings p8 Price medical care p9 Price transport communication p10 Price recreation education p11 Price miscellaneous q1 Quantity food (per capita) q2 Quantity beverages (per capita) q3 Quantity tobacco (per capita) q4 Quantity clothing footwear (per capita) q5 Quantity gross rents (per capita) q6 Quantity house furnishings (per capita) q7 Quantity house furnishings (per capita) q8 Quantity medical care (per capita) q9 Quantity transport communications (per capita) q10 Quantity recreating education (per capita) q11 Quantity miscellaneous (per capita)

what: Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
title: Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
text: Calculates Gheary Khamis "world prices" corresponding quantity index (normalized prices last good set unity).

title: Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
text: P m x n matrix (dataframe) prices (row country, column goods). Q m x n matrix (dataframe) quantities (row country, column goods). pop Optional m-vector population numbers (Q per capita).

title: Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
text: list two elements: pi, n-vector prices y, m-vector incomes.

title: Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
text: Gheary Khamis index, makes difference whether quantities total country-numbers per capita numbers. quantity matrix per capita, one also supply population vector proper weighting. per capita quantities supplied, quantity index returned also per capita.

title: Gheary Khamis world prices and quantity index — gk
Fisher ideal price index. — p_fisher
text: Fisher ideal index takes geometric mean Paasche Laspeyre indices. m countries n goods, data (m x n) matrices.

title: Fisher ideal price index. — p_fisher
text: P  m x n  matrix prices (row country, column goods). Q m x n matrix quantities (row country, column goods).

title: Fisher ideal price index. — p_fisher
text: m x m matrix country pair comparisons.

title: Laspeyre price index. — p_laspeyre
text: Laspeyre price index calculated $$ \frac{\sum_i p^t_i q^b_t}{\sum_i p^b_i q^b_i}.$$ Arguments can either vectors matrices.

title: Laspeyre price index. — p_laspeyre
text: pt n-vector (m x n matrix) prices current period. pb n-vector (m x n matrix) prices baseline period. qb n-vector (m x n matrix) quantities baseline period.

title: Laspeyre price index. — p_laspeyre
text: Price index current baseline period (number vector).

title: Paasche price index. — p_paasche
text: Paasche price index calculated $$ \frac{\sum_i p^t_i q^t_t}{\sum_i p^b_i q^t_i}.$$ Arguments can either vectors matrices.

title: Paasche price index. — p_paasche
text: pt n-vector (m x n matrix) prices current period. pb n-vector (m x n matrix) prices baseline period. qt n-vector (n x n matrix) quantities current period.

title: Paasche price index. — p_paasche
text: Price index current baseline period (number vector).

text: convenience function, returns quantity index vector. Calls gk returns index.

title: Geary Khamis quantity index — ygk
code: ygk(P, Q, pop = NULL, min_scale = FALSE)

title: Geary Khamis quantity index — ygk
text: P m x n matrix (dataframe) prices (row country, column goods). Q m x n matrix (dataframe) quantities (row country, column goods). pop Optional m-vector population numbers (Q per capita). min_scale real income scaled units relative least income country?

title: Geary Khamis quantity index — ygk
text: m-vector quantities.
